about_the_game:
To play Pic-Me! it requires at least 4-8 players to start the lobby. You can either join public lobbies with integrated voice chat, or private lobbies with your friends.

Test your creativity and how good you know your friends in this round-based cardgame!
Every round one of you will become the writer, and they have a tricky job ahead of them. They have to write a short text hinting at the card they want to play. After the hint has been given, everyone else gets to play one card in an attempt to imitate the writer! After all cards have been played the players have to figure out which card belongs to the writer! Now it gets interesting, if the writer made it too obvious and everyone picks their card, they get 0 points. The same applies if they make it so difficult no one figures it out. Only someone who manages to strike the right balance can win it all!

Pic-Me is also playable with strangers through our lobby system and ingame voice chat!

Endless Amount of Cards!

Play with our lovingly handcrafted deck that contains over 75 unique images or use our workshop function to play with one of the countless user-generated decks! If you want to, you can even easily create a deck yourself, with the help of our simple deck generator!

Create your character to your liking!

Customize your character however you like with the character creator, and unlock new accessories as you play!

Play every match the way you want to!

Our game offers a variety of settings to tweak the rules, you can set the game up however you and your friend group want to!

Pic-Me doesn't just guarantee a fun time for you and your friends, it might also strengthen your bond! (or maybe you'll all hate each other by the end, who's to say?)

short_description: Pic-Me! is a card game about deception, where players use wonderous images to spark creativity and imagination. Each round becomes an intricate mindgame against the other players at the table. Will you be able to outsmart your friends or will you be tricked by them? 4-8 players only.
